clinical_study.brief_title: Come As You Are - Assessing the Efficacy of a Nurse Case Management HIV Prevention and Care Intervention Among Homeless Youth
clinical_study.official_title: Come As You Are - Assessing the Efficacy of a Nurse Case Management HIV Prevention and Care Intervention Among Homeless Youth

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to to determine the efficacy of the Nurse Case Management HIV (NCM4HIV) intervention on HIV prevention compared to usual care among Youth Experiencing Homelessness (YEH).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who use preventive prophylaxis (PrEP)
Number of participants who use preventive prophylaxis (PrEP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after intervention (at end of 3-month intervention)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mental health as measured by the Brief Symptom Index-18
secondary_outcome.description: The Brief Symptom Inventory 18 (BSI-18) consists of 18 items on a 5-point (0-4) Likert scale and is designed to assess current psychological distress (over the past 7 days). Total score ranges from 0 to 72, with higher scores indicating greater distress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mental health as measured by the Brief Symptom Index-18
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after intervention (at end of 3-month intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: The BSI-18 consists of 18 items on a 5-point (0-4) Likert scale and is designed to assess current psychological distress (over the past 7 days). Total score ranges from 0 to 72, with higher scores indicating greater distress.

Participants will be asked if they live in a shelter, apartment/house, with someone, outside, or in a car, etc.

arm_group.description: Participant will receive NCM4HIV intervention which includes Personalized HIV prevention education, behavior goal-setting,behavioral self-monitoring,Pre exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) eligibility screening,PrEP/non occupational post exposure prophylaxis(nPEP)services (labs, medication), healthcare planning/coordination, Motivational Interviewing (MI) counseling approach, assisting with cognitive appraisals (clarifying misconceptions),promoting health seeking and coping behaviors that incorporate the situational, personal, social, and resource needs affecting health

Participants will receive the usual care which includes Housing, food, and clothing needs,health assessment, basic healthcare, limited anticipatory guidance, mental health counseling,substance use treatment referrals,PrEP/nPEP referrals

intervention.description: Participant will receive NCM4HIV intervention which includes Personalized HIV prevention education, behavior goal-setting,behavioral self-monitoring, PrEP eligibility screening,PrEP/nPEP services (labs, medication), healthcare planning/coordination, MI counseling approach, assisting with cognitive appraisals (clarifying misconceptions),promoting health seeking and coping behaviors that incorporate the situational, personal, social, and resource needs affecting health

Participant will receive usual care which includes Housing, food, and clothing needs,health assessment, basic healthcare, limited anticipatory guidance, mental health counseling, substance use treatment referrals, PrEP/nPEP referrals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- youth engaged in high-risk sexual activity or intravenous drug use
- speak English
- homeless
- not planning to move out of the metro area during the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- youth with very low literacy
- severe acute mental symptoms
